main event: Multiple reports of an unidentified flying object, described as a luminous white, cigar-shaped object similar in size to a C-54 fuselage, were made on 21st September 1957 in the Panama Canal Zone.
interesting points: Witnesses reported the object emitting a fluorescent white glow and moving at a speed of approximately 100 knots before disappearing suddenly.
Radar operators at Fort Clayton confirmed tracking the object, which moved at a tremendous speed before disappearing.
The object was observed for several minutes in a 'stationary hovering attitude' before moving at a stated rate of speed from west to east.
The sighting occurred in good visibility after a local thunder shower, and observer winds aloft and weather conditions were documented.
The report also includes a handwritten note suggesting the possibility of the sighting being associated with 'ball lightning' or fireballs.
